subject: Re: Diode EVP Capture Device I built
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Al,

Yes, I'm pretty sure it came from the ion lamp as it sparked and sent 
its bolts all around the glass.  It shocked me that the device 
detected so much. At first I thought it was speaking, as it sounds 
like some sort of speech and the waves were actually good sine 
configurations.
I will have to play around with the audio file and see if speed 
adjustment brings out anything, as you suggested.
Wouldn't that be cool if entities were using this as a form of 
communication...

Thanks,
- Mike (UFO Geek)

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "threadsintyme@..." 
<Threadsintyme@...> wrote:
>
> Mike,
> You did indeed, pick up energy. Is this energy "intelligent 
energy", IE, did the energy carry any sign of intelligent 
communication? 
> Is there any way to try to slow the recording down; or, modulating 
the recording to see if there's any intelligent communication?
> The energy that you were picking up...could it have originated form 
the Ion lamp?
> Thanks for a great experiment!
> Al
> 
> -- "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" <michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
> 
> Well, I did some testing of the device this evening... and wow! It 
> worked better than I thought it would.
> It's not a microphone but it picks up energy in the area and 
produces 
> waveforms.
> I've produced a short video showing a demonstration of what it 
> captured in two modes. You can see that video, here:
> 
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqRI0F59uDk
> 
> Thanks,
> - Mike (UFO Geek)
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
> <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > My prototype design of an EVP capture device using diodes, coils,
> > resistors. This allows for the capture of EVP without a 
microphone.
> > Plugs into a tape recorder, digital recorder, or computer. 
Similar 
> to
> > the Raudive diode device used in the 1970's.
> > If you'd like, you can see it here:
> > http://ufomagazine.blogspot.com/2008/11/mikes-diode-evp-capture-
> device.h\
> > tml
> > <http://ufomagazine.blogspot.com/2008/11/mikes-diode-evp-capture-
> device.\
> > html>
> > 
> > Now... on with a few tests.
> > 
> > - Mike (UFO Geek)
> >
>
